An individualized campus visit is a great way to learn if Rocky Mountain College is the right fit for you. Walk around our campus on a guided tour with one of our student ambassadors, have lunch in the cafeteria with current students, sit in on a class, chat with a professor, and meet with your admission counselor – we can create a schedule just for you.
Schedule an individualized visit to campus
*Some dates may be unavailable due to events on campus or office closures. We apologize for any inconvenience.

RMC Preview Days are an opportunity for prospective students to explore what the College has to offer as well as ask questions about the admission process. The schedule includes a campus tour and a mock class, as well as a parent presentation about student life and academics. For students interested in aviation or equestrian studies, you will get a chance to see the respective facilities and meet with a professor. The 2019-2020 Preview Days are:

Note: Preview Day events start at 8:30 a.m. and are approximately four hours long. Aviation, Equestrian, and Heath Science majors encompass an afternoon program-specific schedule in addition to the preview day, see below for details.
Overview of Admissions and Financial Aid
An RMC Professor will conduct a mock class in their discipline; it may not be within your preferred major concentration.
Travel to and tour Aviation Hall
Tour Aviation Hall with a professor where your major specific classes are housed and view/test one of the full motion flight simulators.
Travel to and tour Aviation Flight Operations Center

Tour the RMC Flight Operations Center at the Billings Logan International Airport. Weather permitting, students interested in pursuing a degree in Aeronautical Science (Piloting) can take an introductory flight in one of the RMC-owned airplanes.
Travel to and tour one of the two RMC Equestrian facilities
Experience what RMC has to offer our Equestrian majors and concentrations that afford our students a hands-on learning environment.
Travel to and tour the Billings Medical Facilities (please note: these tours are not avilable for Saturday visits)
Tour of one of two hospital facilities located within 5 miles of campus. Past tours have included visits of the NICU, SIMs lab (simulated birth / heart attack), Health Flight, and Surgery / OR tour.
Sign up for the Scholarship Dinner & Early Registration Event

The Scholarship Dinner is a special event recognizing admitted students for their academic achievements. The Scholarship Dinner will take place on the evening of April 17, 2020. Students are also invited to attend the Early Registration Event on Saturday, April 18, 2020. This will be the first group opportunity to register for fall 2020 classes. The registration group check-in times begin in the morning on Saturday and will be emailed separately the week of the events. Space is limited, please RSVP to either/both of these events by filling out the form above.

After confirming enrollment for the upcoming academic year, new students must register for classes. In order to prepare, students should be familiar with the processes leading up to their class registration. Click here to view more information about

New students must sign up for one of the pre-scheduled registration days in order to register for classes. The campus registration events will take place on the afternoon of Friday, May 15, 2020 or Friday, June 5, 2020. If one of these dates does not work for you, please contact your
. Please RSVP to attend by following one of the links above.
For questions regarding campus visits or preview days, please contact Megan Cabe, event and visit coordinator, at

If you are unable to attend a campus visit during the week, Saturday campus visits are available on the first and third Saturday of each month upon request from 9:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m., with the exception of holiday weekends and Saturdays in the months of June through August. (Holiday closures are listed below.) Faculty availability may be limited depending on the day and other scheduled activities.
At RMC, the faculty and staff are devoted to your success
Rocky Mountain College is a wonderful place to learn, grow, experience, and explore, but more importantly, succeed.

We understand that the college selection process can be overwhelming; however, our goal is to assist you through the process in a positive and comfortable manner. We encourage you to take a look around. Ask plenty of questions and
campus personally. Only you can decide if Rocky Mountain College is the best investment for you, and our
Visiting our campus and taking a tour is the best way to get firsthand information about Rocky Mountain College. You can schedule an individualized visit or attend one of our scheduled preview days.
"I learned about Rocky when an admissions counselor visited my high school in Roberts, Montana in 2013, where I was a foreign exchange student."
Our admissions counselors travel to high schools and college fairs throughout the school year. Find out when the next RMC admissions counselor will be in your area.
percentage of full-time faculty with highest degree in their field
One-on-one and small-group interactions led by professionals with real-life experience in their fields are essential ingredients to a great education at RMC.

RMC invites applications for admission from students who demonstrate academic ability and who are seriously interested in total development of character, intellect, leadership, and skills. Admission is based upon careful review of all credentials presented by an applicant. Selection is made without regard to race, color, gender, age, religion, national or ethnic origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, or familial status. All applicants for admission are reviewed on an individual, rolling basis.

At Rocky Mountain College, the admission process is designed to provide our admission team with background information regarding your previous education, co-curricular and community involvement, achievements, and career interests so that we might learn more about you as a future student and provide you with the very best service. We encourage all students to
so we can personally get to know you and you can personally determine if RMC is the best place to continue your education.

We are confident that you will find everything you are looking for at Rocky Mountain College. Our application fee and essay requirements are currently being waived. You also benefit from priority scholarship consideration and notification of an admission decision within two weeks. Complete your application today!
